course.course_group: East Asian Film and Media Studies
course.title: From Propaganda to Testimony: East Asian History on Film: Seminar
course.description: How have films documented, represented, or even made history in modern China, Japan, Korea, and Taiwan? Examines diverse ways by which films can or cannot tell the "truth" about history. Topics: film propaganda under colonial and authoritarian regimes, during wars and revolutions; contemporary political and ethical implications of cinematic testimonies.
course.prerequisites: Students should have some basic background in modern East Asian history.
